pages.text: Ainiktozoon was an early Thylacocephalan that lived during the Silurian period. It resembled a shrimp with a large head carapace that stuck outwards. Its name comes from the Greek ainiktos(enigmatic) and zoon(animal).
$(l)Eats:$() Fish Food$(br)$(l)Breeds with:$() Fish Food$(br)$(l)Egg Type:$() Drops Egg$(br)$(l)Method of Obtaining:$() Bucket
